Package main.ui

Class CommandLineUI

java.lang.Object
main.ui.CommandLineUI
public class CommandLineUI extends Object
This class implements a command line UI that the player interacts with to receive output from the game. The player can use this command line to setup the game, view stats, view squad, visit the shop and arena and progress through the game.
Version:
1.1, May 2022.
Author:
Lucas Redding

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructor

    CommandLineUI()
    Constructor that initializes the game and scanner objects.

  • Constructor Details

    • CommandLineUI

      public CommandLineUI()
      Constructor that initializes the game and scanner objects. The scanner object reads from the standard input to take user input from the command line.

  • Method Details

    • inputName

      public String inputName()
      Asks for a user name from the user through the standard input and reads the user input and returns the user name. Checks first if the name that was input is valid. If the input name was invalid then prints out to the standard input what the constraints of a valid name are and asks again for the user to input a user name.
      Returns:
      the valid name input by the user.

    • inputDays

      public int inputDays()
      Asks the user for the amount of days they want the game to run for through the standard input, reads the user input and returns the amount of days. Checks first if the amount of days that was input is valid. An amount of days is valid if it is between 5 and 15 (inclusive). If the input amount of days was invalid then prints out to the standard input what the constraints of a valid amount of days are and asks again for the user to input an amount of days.
      Returns:
      the valid amount of days input by the user.

    • pickMonsterName

      public Monster pickMonsterName(Monster monster)
      Asks the player for input to rename a given monster.
      Parameters:
      monster - the Monster the user is choosing a new name for.
      Returns:
      the monster that is the renamed Monster

    • chooseStartMonster

      public Monster chooseStartMonster()
      Asks for the user to select a starter monster from a given list of monsters, then returns the monster chosen. The available monsters is set as a list of newly created common monsters. The list of monsters is printed to the standard input along with their id numbers. The user is asked to input the id number of their chosen starter monster and then the input checked for validity. Once the input from the player is valid the chosen monster is returned.
      Returns:
      the chosen starter monster.

    • chooseDifficulty

      public int chooseDifficulty()
      Asks for the user to input a difficulty from 1 to 2. 1 is easy and 2 is hard. The input is checked to see if it meets the restrictions. Once the input is valid it is returned as an integer describing the chosen difficulty.
      Returns:
      the integer representation of the chosen difficulty.

    • setup

      public void setup()
      One by one calls the methods associated with setting up the game and stores their outputs to set the starting game environment.

    • displayDailyOptions

      public void displayDailyOptions()
      Displays to the command line all of the available daily options for the user. Each option has a number ID above it used when the player selects one of the options.

    • displaySquad

      public void displaySquad()
      Displays a string representation of the user player's squad of monsters. Each monster is displayed with its index in the squad above it.

    • viewSquad

      public void viewSquad()
      Displays a list of all of the user player's squad of monsters. The monsters and their stats are displayed in the order they battle in. On pressing enter the game loop is called to return to the main game loop.

    • displayInventory

      public void displayInventory()
      Displays a string representation of the user player's inventory of items. The items are displayed with their name above their description. Each item is displayed with its index in the inventory above it.

    • useItem

      public void useItem(int itemIndex)
      Asks the user player to choose the ID of the monster they want to use their item on and then uses it. Prints a success message when item has been used.
      Parameters:
      itemIndex - the integer of the index in the player's inventory of the item to be used.

    • viewInventory

      public void viewInventory()
      Displays a list of all of the user player's inventory of items. The player is given the option to pick an item to use and which monster to use it on. On an empty input the game loop is called to return to the main game loop.

    • sellShop

      public void sellShop()
      Displays a list of the user player's items and monsters and lets them pick one to sell. The player sells an item by entering its Id number. The player can return to shop without selling by pressing enter with no input.

    • displayMonsterStock

      public void displayMonsterStock()
      Displays a string representation of the shop's list of monsters in stock. The monsters are displayed with their id and price above. If the shop is empty a print out tells the player.

    • monsterShop

      public void monsterShop()
      Asks the user to input the Id of the monster they wish to buy. If the player has enough money and their squad is not full then the purchase is successful. Otherwise an error message is displayed to the player. Leaving the input blank will return the user to the buy shop.

    • displayItemStock

      public void displayItemStock()
      Displays a string representation of the shop's list of items in stock. The items are displayed with their id and price above. If the shop is empty a print out tells the player.

    • itemShop

      public void itemShop()
      Asks the user to input the Id of the item they wish to buy. If the player has enough money then the purchase is successful. Otherwise an error message is displayed to the player. Leaving the input blank will return the user to the buy shop.

    • buyShop

      public void buyShop()
      Asks the user whether they want to buy items or monsters then displays the corresponding shop UI. If the input is left blank the user is moved back to the main shop UI.

    • visitShop

      public void visitShop()
      Asks the player whether they want to sell or buy at the shop, then moves to correct UI. if the input is left blank the user is moved back to main game loop.

    • displayEnemySquad

      public void displayEnemySquad(Enemy enemy)
      Display's the squad of the given enemy with the index of each monster in the squad above it.
      Parameters:
      enemy - the Enemy that has the squad of monsters to display

    • viewEnemyTeam

      public void viewEnemyTeam(int enemyIndex)
      Display's an enemy and their squad to the player and lets player choose if they want to fight the enemy. If the player decides to battle the enemy then a summary of the battle is printed to the player.] The player cannot fight the enemy if all their monsters are fainted.
      Parameters:
      enemyIndex - the integer index of the enemy being displayed in the arena's enemy array

    • viewOppenents

      public void viewOppenents()
      Displays a list of the available opponents that the player to challenge to a battle. Below the name of the enemy is the reward in gold and points for defeating them.

    • enterArena

      public void enterArena()
      Displays a list of today's opponents in the arena and gives the player the option to get more information on each. The player can enter the number of the opponent for more information or leave input blank to return to the main menu.

    • endScreen

      public void endScreen()
      Displays an end screen to the player with their name and score in points.

    • sleep

      public void sleep()
      Calls the sleep method from the game environment and prints out the night events. If the the game is complete (all days have passed) the end screen is called. Otherwise the player is returned to the main menu.

    • gameLoop

      public void gameLoop()
      The main loop of the game UI. Displays the game day and player's gold to the user and then displays all of the available daily options to the user. Reads and parses input from the player to decide which UI to call based on what option the user chooses.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      The main method to create and launch the game from the command line interface.
      Parameters:
      args - the string command line arguments
